Package checker

Class Scope

java.lang.Object
checker.Scope
public class Scope
extends java.lang.Object
Scope class is a class that stores information about opened scope Class contains information about declared variable types, offsets, opened nested levels. Class provides methods to put new variables into a scope, open/close nested levels, retrieve variable types, offset positions, size of the scope
Author:
Karolis Butkus

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Scope()
    Constructs a fresh, initially empty scope.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void closeNestedLevel()
    Closes top nested level of the scope
    boolean contains​(java.lang.String id)
    Tests if a given identifier is declared in this scopes currently opened nested level.
    int getScopeDepth()
    Returns the depth of current scopes (how many nested levels are opened).
    boolean isUsed​(java.lang.String id)
    Returns if the variable has been used in the currently inner-most nested level.
    java.lang.Integer offset​(java.lang.String id)
    Returns the offset of a given (presumably declared) identifier.
    void openNestedLevel()
    Opens new nested level of the scope
    boolean put​(java.lang.String id, Type type)
    Declares an identifier with a given type, if the identifier is not yet declared in this scope's current nested level.
    void putUsed​(java.lang.String id, Type type)
    Puts variable in used nested level so that program knows that this variable has already been used inside this level.
    int size()
    Return size of the scope which can be used to determine local data area size in the activation record
    Type type​(java.lang.String id)
    Returns the type of a given (presumably declared) identifier.
    int variableDepth​(java.lang.String id)
    Returns the relative depth of variable in the nested levels

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Scope

      public Scope()
      Constructs a fresh, initially empty scope.

  • Method Details

    • openNestedLevel

      public void openNestedLevel()
      Opens new nested level of the scope

    • closeNestedLevel

      public void closeNestedLevel()
      Closes top nested level of the scope
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if scope contains only one level

    • getScopeDepth

      public int getScopeDepth()
      Returns the depth of current scopes (how many nested levels are opened).
      Returns:
      current scope depth

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(java.lang.String id)
      Tests if a given identifier is declared in this scopes currently opened nested level.
      Parameters:
      id - - the name of the identifier
      Returns:
      true if top nested level contains identifier; false if identifier is not declared in the current nested level of this scope

    • put

      public boolean put​(java.lang.String id, Type type)
      Declares an identifier with a given type, if the identifier is not yet declared in this scope's current nested level.
      Returns:
      true if the identifier was added; false if it was already declared.

    • type

      public Type type​(java.lang.String id)
      Returns the type of a given (presumably declared) identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - - the name of the identifier
      Returns:
      type of the specified identifier if identifier is declared in this scope; null if identifier is not declared

    • offset

      public java.lang.Integer offset​(java.lang.String id)
      Returns the offset of a given (presumably declared) identifier. With respect to the beginning of this scope's activation record. Offsets are assigned in order of declaration.
      Parameters:
      id - - the name of the identifier
      Returns:
      the offset to the identifier in this scope's activation record. If identifier is not declared return null

    • variableDepth

      public int variableDepth​(java.lang.String id)
      Returns the relative depth of variable in the nested levels
      Parameters:
      id - - the name of the identifier
      Returns:
      0 if variable resides in the top nested level, -1 if variable is not declared

    • putUsed

      public void putUsed​(java.lang.String id, Type type)
      Puts variable in used nested level so that program knows that this variable has already been used inside this level.
      Parameters:
      id - - the name of the identifier
      type - - the type of the identifier

    • isUsed

      public boolean isUsed​(java.lang.String id)
      Returns if the variable has been used in the currently inner-most nested level. Used to prevent use before re-declare errors.
      Parameters:
      id - - the name of the identifier
      Returns:
      true if identifier is already used; false if identifier is not used

    • size

      public int size()
      Return size of the scope which can be used to determine local data area size in the activation record
      Returns:
      the size of the scope (in integer size units)
